channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: For Gene Hackman, Santa Fe was a refuge from the limelight
Pope Francis has calm night after breathing crisis caused recovery setback
item.description: Pope Francis had a peaceful night with no crises after a bronchial crisis prompted a worsening of his health.

item.title: Pope has 'peaceful night' after breathing crisis, Vatican says
item.description: The Pope has been battling pneumonia for two weeks and suffered an "isolated" breathing crisis on Friday.

item.title: Eye on America: Exclusive look inside the intense training of U.S. Marshals
item.description: In Pennsylvania, we get an exclusive look at how the U.S. Marshals Fugitive Task Force trains to apprehend some of the countryâ€™s most wanted criminals...

item.title: Leonard Peltier remains defiant in AP interview, maintaining innocence and vowing continued activism
How to watch the Oscars on Sunday night
item.description: The 97th Academy Awards will air on ABC and stream on Hulu at 7 p.m. ET. Comedian and actor Conan O'Brien is hosting and Wicked stars Ariana Grande an...

item.title: Kurdish group PKK declares ceasefire with Turkey
item.description: The PKK calls for the release of its jailed leader Abdullah Ocalan to lead a process of disarmament.

item.title: European leaders back Zelensky after Trump clash
item.description: The Ukrainian president thanks European leaders for their support after a flurry of messages on social media.

item.title: In the federal court system, law clerks find little recourse for bullying and abuse
item.description: An NPR investigation finds federal judges have enormous influence with few checks on their power. Law clerks and other judicial employees are vulnerab...

item.title: Can Faith Kipyegon break four minutes in the mile? Scientists say yes.
item.description: Faith Kipyegon, the fastest female miler in the world, could dip under 4 minutes with an extra boost from pacers.

item.title: Trump will address Congress. Why isn't this first speech called a State of the Union?
item.description: Trump will give his first speech to Congress next Tuesday since his reelection. It has characteristics of what Americans call a State of the Union add...

item.title: The Uplift: A Dynamic Duo
item.description: A man with cerebral palsy and his racing partner attempt to complete six Abbott World Marathon Majors, with one left: Tokyo. David Begnaud has an upda...

item.title: Hamas rejects Israel's request to extend phase one of Gaza ceasefire
item.description: Hamas says it is not willing to extend the first phase of the Gaza ceasefire, rejecting an Israeli request to delay negotiations on the second phase.

item.title: Steve Rosenberg: Vladimir Putin can afford to sit back and watch events unfold
item.description: A breakdown in relations between Ukraine and the US is potentially very serious for Kyiv, but very positive for Moscow.

item.title: How an Idaho boy's ninth birthday wish struck an entirely different tone
item.description: When Grant Mullen's parents asked him what he wanted for his ninth birthday, they were pleasantly surprised by the answer.

item.title: Ukrainians back Zelensky after disastrous White House encounter
item.description: The more the country is attacked, the more unity there is, Ukrainians tell the BBC in Kyiv.

item.title: Gene Hackman and his wife tested negative for carbon monoxide, sheriff says
item.description: Authorities investigating the deaths of Oscar-winner Gene Hackman and his wife are waiting for more details from their autopsies to determine why they...

item.title: Pentagon firings expand to top military lawyers
item.description: A bipartisan group of former U.S. defense secretaries are now asking Congress to investigate the Trump administration's firing of top brass at the Pen...
